Other Useful Features
Moogle Treasure Trove
Event Overview

The <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Moogle Treasure Trove<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a special event held at irregular intervals. Complete objectives during the event to obtain <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>irregular tomestones<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which can be traded to <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>itinerant moogles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for a variety of rare items.
Event Schedule

The Moogle Treasure Trove is held for a set duration, which can be viewed from the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Mogpendium<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. From this menu, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Access Special Site<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to view a detailed schedule.
An icon will appear above itinerant moogles while the event is underway.
Irregular Tomestones
Obtaining Tomestones

Irregular tomestones can be obtained by completing objectives during the Moogle Treasure Trove event, and can be exchanged for various rewards. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The types of irregular tomestones available will change each time the event is held.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Itinerant Moogles

Speak with itinerant moogles to exchange irregular tomestones for a variety of items.
Itinerant moogles can be found near the aetheryte plaza in the following locations:
Limsa Lominsa Lower Decks New Gridania Ul'dah - Steps of Nald
Objectives
Categories

The objectives for the Moogle Treasure Trove can be confirmed from the Mogpendium. Objectives are divided into the following four categories:
1. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Standard objectives<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which can be completed repeatedly. 2. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Weekly objectives<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which can be completed once a week. 3. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Minimog challenges<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which can be completed once a week. 4. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ultimog challenges<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which can only be completed once per event period.
Non-repeatable objectives provide greater quantities of tomestones, so prioritize them to get the items you want.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Irregular tomestones will not be awarded when using adventurer squadrons or the Duty Support system.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Irregular tomestone rewards are only available to unrestricted parties if the “Level Sync” option is applied.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Standard Objectives

Standard objectives can be completed an unlimited number of times during the event period, and irregular tomestones are collected automatically when the objective is complete.
Not every objective will give the same quantity of tomestones, so check the Mogpendium before choosing which to undertake.
Weekly Objectives

A weekly objective is assigned to each player every week, and provides an opportunity to obtain a large number of tomestones. Tomestone rewards for weekly objectives can be collected from the Mogpendium. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Tomestone rewards must be collected before they expire.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Objectives will change weekly, so make sure to complete them before time runs out.
Minimog Challenges

Minimog challenges can be completed once per week, and their rewards can be collected from the Mogpendium. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Players can complete either of the two available challenges per week.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Tomestone rewards must be collected before they expire.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Challenges will change weekly, so make sure to complete them before time runs out.
Ultimog Challenges

Ultimog challenges can only be completed once per event period, and their rewards can be collected from the Mogpendium. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Tomestone rewards must be collected before they expire.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Configuration Settings

Crystalline Conflict settings can be adjusted via the Character Configuration menu. Open UI Settings, navigate to the HUD tab, and select or deselect options under the Crystalline Conflict (PvP) heading to best suit your style of play.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Progress Gauge■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enabling “Display affiliated team on left side of Progress Gauge.” will configure the Progress Gauge to always display your current team─Astra or Umbra─on the left. Changes to this setting made during a match will be reflected upon commencement of the next match.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Map■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enabling “Display affiliated team on left side of map.” will configure the map to always display your current team's base on the left. Changes to this setting made during a match will be reflected upon commencement of the next match.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Countdown■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Select “Display final countdown.” to show a countdown timer for the final ten seconds of the match.
The Red Sands
No effort was spared in reproducing the desert's deadly perils for this staging ground. Those bold souls that master both sun and sand will be the first to claim victory.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Shifting Sands■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Ride the shifting sands to travel swiftly to a specific location on the field.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Sandpits■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The crystal line intersects with these ringlike nests at checkpoints. Clearing any such checkpoint with the tactical crystal in tow will result in one of the following denizens emerging from within:
・Red Sands Antlion The antlion will drag all players in range deep into the nest, rendering them immobile before erupting from the sands to deal massive damage.
・Sabotender The sabotender will unleash 100,000 Needles upon all players in range. As the needles are split between affected players, the damage dealt to each player will change accordingly.
・Acutender This rare and curious creature will unleash Therapeutic Needles upon all players in range, granting them a barrier effect. As the needles are split between affected players, the strength of the barrier granted to each player will change accordingly.
* If the match proceeds into overtime, monsters will no longer emerge from the sandpits.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Oasis■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The arena's oasis area grants players within a special effect that regenerates HP over time. The effect will remain for a time after exiting the oasis.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Heat Waves■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Heat waves atop the Red Sands will deal damage over time to all competitors. However, relief can be found at sandpits, from which balming geysers will erupt. Players standing in one of the small circular indicators on the ground will be soothed by sandpearl shrouds, granting the following effects: ・HP recovery. ・A boost to the limit gauge.
While the geyser is erupting, no creatures will emerge from the sandpit. Nevertheless, caution is advised, as the force of the geyser will deal damage to and knock back any who approach its center.
Blunderville
Blunderville HUD
Overview

Blunderville is a battle royale mode where up to 24 players vie against each other in a set of obstacle courses. Complete each of the three stages before your rivals and fight for your right to the victor's crown.
The longer you remain in the running, the more rewards you'll earn, so keep your eyes on the prize as you race to be the last one standing!
Participating

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Registering for a Show■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> You may speak with the Blunderville registrar to participate in a show.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Classes and Jobs■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> All jobs and classes, including limited jobs, may participate in Blunderville.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Solo Registration■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Solo challengers may speak with the Blunderville registrar to participate.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Party Registration■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The party leader must speak with the Blunderville registrar to join the show with their currently formed party. Parties can be registered regardless of size.
Please note that your final rank will be calculated by personal progress rather than party progress.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Alliance Registration■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The alliance leader must speak with the Blunderville registrar to join the show with their currently formed alliance. You must have a full alliance of 24 players to participate.
Lobbyville

Players who have registered for a show will be sent to wait in Lobbyville. The show will begin when 24 challengers have gathered, or after a set amount of time has passed since the first challenger entered Lobbyville.
Rewards will be adjusted based on the number of challengers in each show.
Spectating

Those who qualify for the next stage will enter spectator mode, where they may freely watch the remaining challengers compete. Please note that you will become invisible while spectating.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Spectating when Qualified■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Challengers who qualify for the next stage will remain in spectator mode until the next round begins.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Spectating when Eliminated■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Challengers who have been eliminated may remain in spectator mode until the end of the show. If you wish to leave spectator mode, you may do so at any time by selecting the Leave option from the Blunderville menu.
Rewards

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■MGF■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> MGF, or Manderville Gold Saucer Fame, is awarded to all Blunderville challengers after a show has concluded. MGF is calculated based on your final rank in the show.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Exchanging MGF■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> MGF can be exchanged in Blunderville Square for exclusive rewards.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Viewing Your MGF■<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> You may view the MGF currently in your possession by speaking with the MGF trader. Up to 10,000 MGF can be held at a time.
Overview

A special HUD layout will display in Blunderville and Blunderville Square, indicating your progress in the stage you are currently on.
The Blunderville HUD can only be adjusted in Blunderville and Blunderville Square. Select HUD Layout from the System menu, or unlock and adjust the HUD manually.
HUD Guide

1. Indicates the stage's objective.
2. Indicates the number of crystals successfully carried and the number of crystals needed to qualify for the next round in the Saucery Siege stage.
3. Indicates the number of participants who have qualified for the next stage. In the Gold Swiveller stage, the number of eliminated players will also be displayed.
4. Indicates time remaining to complete the stage.
Spectator HUD Guide

1. Allows you to spectate from specific locations on the stage.
2. Allows you to leave the show if you have already been eliminated.
3. Indicates whether you have been qualified or eliminated from the stage.

Authorization
A variety of different features exist to help you find the perfect look for your character. This guide explains how each of these customization options function.

Glamours are a means of projecting the appearance of one piece of equipment onto another.
This is a reversible effect which can be redone any number of times.
Casting glamours requires catalysts known as <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>glamour prisms<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, with one prism being consumed per cast.

To cast a glamour, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu and open the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Actions & Traits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window, then select the Cast Glamour action under the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>General<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> tab. You can also use this action from the subcommand menu of the item you wish to glamour.
From the Cast Glamour window, choose the base item, then select the glamour you wish to cast from the list of available items.
The presence of a glamour is indicated by a symbol in the upper right corner of the item icon.
Additionally, the item help window will display the name of the original item followed by the name of the glamoured item in alternating sequence.

Glamour prisms can be purchased from the market board, obtained from Grand Company quartermasters, or crafted using recipes learned from glamour prism recipe tomes.
Glamour prism recipe tomes can be purchased from Goberin in western Thanalan (X:12.1 Y:15.0) or Tataroga in Mor Dhona (X:22.1 Y:6.7) after completing the quest <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>“Absolutely Glamourous”<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in western Thanalan (X:12.6 Y:14.3).

Restoring a glamoured item to its original appearance requires the use of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>glamour dispellers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which are available for purchase from the market boards or certain vendors.
From the Cast Glamour window, select the glamoured item on the left, then select Remove on the right. This action will consume a glamour dispeller.

You will not be able to cast a glamour if:
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>1. The base item's job level requirement is lower than that of the glamour cast.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Example: Level 100 gear cannot be glamoured onto gear equippable at levels 1 through 99. ※Unaffected by item level (IL).
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>2. The base item's class or role requirement is not compatible with that of the glamour cast.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Example: Tank-specific gear cannot be glamoured onto healer-specific gear.

Some glamours will only display as long as the character's level, class, race, and gender meet the requirements. Example: If a job-specific glamour is applied, the effect will no longer display when the character switches to a different job.

Gear can be rendered invisible when glamoured with emperor's new items of the same gear category.
These invisible items can be purchased from Goberin in western Thanalan (X:12.1 Y:15.0) or Tataroga in Mor Dhona (X:22.1 Y:6.7) after completing the quest <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>“Absolutely Glamourous”<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in western Thanalan (X:12.6 Y:14.3).
While visiting an inn room, items stored in the armoire and glamour dresser can be glamoured onto gear without needing to withdraw them. This action will not consume a glamour prism.

While your retainer is summoned, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Cast Glamours<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the retainer menu to apply glamours to their equipment or any other gear in their possession. You may also use their gear to apply glamours to your own.

You can also cast glamours onto your adventurer squadron members, provided they are at least level 51.
Select the Outfit icon, then select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Apply Glamours<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. You may use the items stored in your armoire and glamour dresser as well as your inventory.

Glamour dressers are available in inn rooms and Grand Company barracks, and can be used to store equipment as glamours, up to the dresser's maximum capacity. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Some relic weapons cannot be stored.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
The initial deposit consumes one <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>glamour prism<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> per item, but stored gear can be projected onto your equipment as many times as you like at no cost.
If you wish to equip a stored item directly, you may retrieve it from the glamour dresser to restore it to its original form.

To determine whether a given item can be stored in the glamour dresser, navigate to the item help window. If the glamour dresser icon in the upper right corner is lit up, the item can be stored.
※A “+” mark indicates the item can be used as part of an outfit glamour.

Open the glamour dresser to access the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Glamour Creation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window, browse different gear categories, and select an item from your inventory or Armoury Chest. Gear with condition below 100% cannot be stored.
Placing an item into the glamour dresser will reset its spiritbond to 0%, as well as remove customization including glamours, crests, signatures, materia, and most aetherial bonuses. The item will also be bound to you upon removal. ※Each item stored will cost one glamour prism. ※Dyes applied to the item will not be reset.

Once an item has been stored in the glamour dresser, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Apply Glamour<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommand menu to glamour your current equipment without spending a glamour prism.
Alternatively, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Edit Glamour Plates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to bring up the Glamour Plate Creation window, where you can create full sets of glamoured attire that can be applied to your character all at once, using items stored in either the glamour dresser or the armoire.

Created using the glamour dressers found inside inn rooms, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>glamour plates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are a means of projecting an entire ensemble onto your gear.
Glamours stored inside a glamour dresser or equipment stored inside an <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>armoire<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can be projected onto your gear, allowing you to concoct a unique look for your character.
Ensembles saved to a glamour plate can be projected over and over again without consuming glamour prisms.

Select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Edit Glamour Plates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the glamour dresser window and choose the plate you wish to edit. You can now select a category (head, body, etc.) followed by a glamour stored in the dresser or an item stored in the armoire. Stored items and glamours are not removed after being added to a plate.
One you are satisfied with your glamour plate, select the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Save<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button.
Items added to glamour plates can also be dyed. This only affects the selected plate─the stored item will retain its original color.
Should you wish to remove an item from a plate, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Remove Item Image from Plate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
※It is not necessary to add items to every category. Depending on the style you are trying to achieve, you can simply create a partially filled plate.

Select the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Apply<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to project the saved ensemble onto your equipped gear. This process does not consume glamour prisms.
※In the event a glamour plate cannot be fully applied, an “X” symbol will be displayed in the corresponding category icons.

Glamour plates can be accessed and used at any time in cities, residential areas, and sanctuaries.
Simply select the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Glamour Plate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button above the character window to view and select a glamour. The window can also be accessed via the General section of the Actions & Traits menu.

You can change the outward appearance of gear sets by linking them to glamour plates. Select the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Link to Glamour Plate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> subcommand from the gear set list to automatically apply the linked glamour plate when switching to the corresponding gear set.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※This feature does not function in instanced areas or outside of large settlements.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Select the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Dispel Glamour<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button in the upper right corner of the Plate Selection window to remove glamours from selected categories.
This process consumes <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>glamour dispellers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

Available in inn rooms or placed as furnishings in player estates, armoires are used to store <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>artifact armor<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>seasonal event costumes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>achievement rewards<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>bonus items<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and other specific gear.
To determine whether a given item can be stored in the armoire, navigate to the item help window. If the armoire icon in the upper right corner is lit up, the item can be stored.
Gear with condition below 100% cannot be stored.
Placing an item into the armoire will reset its spiritbond to 0%, as well as remove all customization. However, you may store and withdraw items at no cost.

Once an item has been stored in the armoire, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Apply Glamour<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommand menu to glamour your current equipment without spending a glamour prism.
Alternatively, items in the armoire can be added to <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>glamour plates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> without needing to store them in the glamour dresser.
Note that any dyes applied to the item will be reset. To preserve existing dyes or add new ones before applying glamours, it is recommended to store the item in the glamour dresser instead.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Crests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are sigils representing different free companies that can be applied to applicable gear. To apply a crest to your gear, speak with an <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>OIC officer of arms<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> belonging to the Grand Company your free company is associated with. Crests can be removed at any time.
An illuminated crest icon in the top right corner of the item help window indicates that the corresponding piece of gear can have a crest applied to it.

Crest design consists of three basic elements: ・The main emblem, or <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Charge<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・The basic shape, or <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Escutcheon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・The basic pattern, or <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ordinary<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Use the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Crest Customization<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> feature to devise a crest your free company can be proud of.

To design and apply a crest, you must first have risen to a sufficient rank within your free company.
・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Crest Customization<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> (Rank 2) gives you the authorization to edit crest designs. ・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Gear Customization<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> (Rank 4) gives you the authorization to apply crests to personal gear. ・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Crest Expansion<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> (Rank 7) unlocks a range of new crest designs.

Facewear refers to a range of facial accessories that can add extra flourish to an ensemble. Unlike standard gear, facewear is purely decorative.
Facewear is acquired by using the corresponding item. Once acquired, facewear can be worn or removed at any time. To do so, simply select Facewear via the Character tab in the Actions & Traits menu, or click the Facewear icon to the bottom left of the character window. This will display an overview of your registered items.

Select an item of facewear to wear in the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Style<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section, and customize it by choosing a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Color<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

You can change the color of gear and furnishing items through the use of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>dyes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, with one pot of dye consumed for each distinct section of an item. ※Some items allow for two dye slots.
Dyed items can be redyed and undyed any number of times.
Dyeable items have circular symbols in the upper right corner of their icons.

If the circle is empty, as shown on the left, no dye has been applied.
If the circle is filled in, as shown in the center, the item has been dyed with the corresponding color.
If there are no circles, as shown on the right, the item cannot be dyed.
If an item has two dye slots, it will display two circles.

There are many different colors of dyes. If you wish to apply the same color to both sections or multiple items, you will need to ensure you have enough dye for each.
Both dyes and terebinth are available from vendors and the market boards, and can also be crafted by Disciples of the Hand from level 30 onwards.

To use a dye, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu and open the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Actions & Traits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window, then select the Dye action under the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>General<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> tab. You can also use this action from the subcommand menu of the item you wish to dye.
From the Item Dyeing window, select the desired item from the list, then select the section you wish to dye.
※For items with a single dye slot, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Dye 1<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will be the only option.
Once you have selected a section, choose your desired color.

Use the colored circles near the top to switch between color categories, then choose your desired dye from the colored squares beneath. Any colors not currently in your possession will be marked with an “X” icon.
You may also use the subcommand menu to set <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>favored dyes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, enabling you to apply your preferred color scheme to multiple items with ease.
Confirm your chosen color settings in the preview pane, then select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Dye<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to begin the process.

Should you wish to restore your gear to its original hue, a pot of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>terebinth<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> removes the dye from a single section of an item.
To use terebinth, select the leftmost square located under the leftmost color category.
Once terebinth has been set to the section you wish to undye, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Dye<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to begin the dye removal process.
Some items cannot be dyed until you have fulfilled specific conditions, indicated by the lock symbol in the upper right corner.

The requirements for these items can be reviewed at any time from the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Item Dyeing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window. Once met, the lock icon will change to a circle.

While your retainer is summoned, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Dye Items<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the retainer menu to apply dyes to their equipment or any other gear in their possession.
Eyewear Accessories

・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>False Spectacles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>False Shaded Spectacles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>False Classic Spectacles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Rose-colored Spectacles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
The items listed above were formerly Fashion Accessories, but are now classified as Facewear. Speak to a Calamity salvager to transfer these items from your acquired Fashion Accessories to your Facewear collection.
Calamity salvagers can be found in the following locations: ・Limsa Lominsa, Upper Decks ・Ul'dah, Steps of Thal ・Old Gridania
Basics of Combat
Attack Markers
Some enemy attacks will show an indication of where they will strike in the form of a marker. In most cases, you can avoid taking damage by moving outside of the highlighted area before it lands.
These markers take many forms.
Enmity

Enmity is the priority system by which an enemy chooses a target. All players entered into combat with the enemy generate enmity through dealing damage or healing allies.
There are two ways to check your current enmity level:
①The Enmity List The enmity list shows all enemies with whom you have generated enmity. The icon on the left indicates your current enmity level. The four levels are displayed below in order of greatest to least.

②The Party List The party list shows each party member's enmity level with the currently selected enemy, as indicated in the lower left corner of the class/job icon.
The player with the greatest enmity is marked with A, followed by 2, 3, and so on. The adjacent gauge shows the relative difference in enmity compared to the player with the most.

During party combat, if you find that the enemies are swarming you instead of the tank, you may wish to withhold your attacks until the tank has regained enmity.
■ Tank Stance Each tank job has a special action that helps to keep their enmity level high.

With tank stance active, attacks dealt to enemies will generate significantly higher enmity, controlling the focus of enemy attacks and thereby helping to keep allies safe. This is a key aspect of playing as a tank in party combat.
Enhancements and Enfeeblements

An enhancement is a status effect that strengthens the player, whereas an enfeeblement is one that weakens the player. The icons for enhancements and enfeeblements you receive will appear in the Status Effects element of your HUD layout.

Enhancements have icons shaped like upward arrows, whereas enfeeblements are shaped like downward arrows. A white line across the top of the icon indicates that the enfeeblement can be removed with certain healing actions such as Esuna.
Types of Markers
Targeting Markers
This marker indicates that you have been targeted with some manner of attack.
The specifics of the ensuing attack will vary depending on the enemy and/or duty, but in all cases, it will involve you in some way.
Area of Effect Markers
This marker indicates that you have been targeted with an area of effect attack. Targeted players should move away from their allies, and vice versa.
Stack Markers

This marker indicates that a powerful area of effect attack is imminent. As a stack marker is all but impossible to survive alone, it is imperative that the targeted player stand with as many allies as possible to divide the damage evenly.
Note that there are two different types of stack marker:
■ Circle Stack
■ Line Stack
Lethal Attack Markers

This marker warns of an incredibly powerful attack. Typically, it targets the player with the most enmity, and because it deals tremendous damage, most non-tank jobs are unlikely to survive it.
Should you be targeted, your defensive abilities can help keep you safe. For example, tanks can use Rampart to lower damage sustained as well as Reprisal to lower enemy damage output. For all other roles, check the Actions & Traits menu to see which defensive abilities your job can learn.
Note that there are a few different markers, each with different areas of effect:
■ Solo Marker Depending on the enemy, these may inflict an area of effect attack.
■ Area of Effect Marker
■ Line / Cleave Marker These attacks will strike the entire area behind the target.
■ Stack Marker The spheres orbiting the center indicate how many players are needed to withstand the attack.
Homing Area of Effect Markers

This marker indicates that you will be chased by a series of area of effect attacks targeting your current location.
Because these attacks will strike rapidly and repeatedly, the best course of action is to stay on the move, away from your allies.
Knockback Markers

This marker indicates that a knockback attack is imminent. When it strikes, you will be pushed a set distance away from the point of impact based on your relative location. Keep this in mind and either position yourself accordingly or use an action that nullifies knockback effects.

Note that there are different types of knockback:
■ Radial Knockback Players will be pushed outwards from the point of impact. If the marker is purple, like this one, it cannot be nullified by job actions.
■ Directional Knockback Players will be pushed in a single set direction.
Area of Effect Knockback Markers

This area of effect marker has an accompanying knockback effect. When it strikes, you will be pushed a set distance away from the point of impact based on your relative location. You will take damage if you stand inside its bounds, so you should position yourself along its outer edges.
If the marker is purple, like this one, it cannot be nullified by job actions.
Flare Markers
This marker indicates that a proximity-based area of effect attack is imminent. The closer you stand to its point of impact, the more damage you will take, so retreat as far as you can.
Sometimes these proximity attacks will target a specific player. To minimize damage, the target should move away from the rest of their party, and vice versa.
Tower Markers
This marker indicates that a tower attack is imminent. If left unoccupied by at least one player, the entire party will take significant damage.

Note that there are different tower markers with different effects:
■ Tank Tower This type of tower hits especially hard. Only a tank should occupy it.
■ Multi-player Towers Some towers require a specific number of players to fully absorb the attack. This number will be indicated by the marker. Displayed below are two examples of two-player towers.
Proximity Tether Markers

This spiky marker indicates that you have been tethered to a hostile force. Remain in close proximity and you will receive some manner of negative effect, be it damage or an enfeeblement.
Fortunately, this type of tether can be negated by moving away until the spikes disappear, like so:

Another type of proximity tether, also known as a chain, will continuously damage both players to whom it is connected so long as they remain in close proximity of one another. Affected players can break this tether by moving away from each other.
Interceptible Tether Markers
This marker indicates that an attack will strike the current target. Depending on the situation, it may be necessary for a player to intercept it by physically blocking it from its target.
Gaze Markers

This marker indicates that a gaze attack is imminent. Any player facing the enemy when this attack strikes will receive some manner of negative effect. Alternatively, sometimes the gaze marker will originate from a player instead.
In both cases, it can be negated by facing away from its source before the attack strikes.
Other Markers

Here you will find descriptions of other attack markers encountered in combat.
■ Number Markers These markers indicate the order in which players will be attacked, starting with the player whose marker has the fewest orbs.
■ Multi-player Markers This marker indicates the number of players who must stand together to survive the attack, as shown by the number of orbs.

■ Countdown Markers These markers count down to an imminent attack, and if you are caught doing a forbidden action when it reaches zero, you will be penalized with damage or an enfeeblement.
All countdown markers serve the same function regardless of enemy or duty, and over time you will learn the forbidden actions typically associated with each one.
Playing with Character Voices
About Mahjong Character Voices

By enabling <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Mahjong Character Voices<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, one of several characters you've encountered on your adventures can be selected to cheer you on during your matches of mahjong. When in a position to call certain hands, or when match points are tallied, character portraits will display with accompanying voiced lines over the course of the match. ※Characters selected by other players will not be shown.
Character Voice Settings

Character voices can be enabled after acquiring special items purchased from <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var><var 28 ((ENpcResident)) F60FF16701 /var><var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Wonder Square. ※Players must first complete the main scenario quest “<var 28 ((Quest)) F601068501 /var>.”
Once purchased, you can open the Gold Saucer menu and navigate to the Mahjong tab. Then, under Mahjong Character Voices, you can select your desired character to be used during matches. You may also select what attire will be used in the selected character's portrait, unlocking additional outfits as you progress through the main scenario.
What Are Outfit Glamours?
Creating Outfit Glamours
Outfit Glamour-ready Gear
Items Comprising an Outfit Glamour

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Outfit glamours<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are a means of projecting the appearance of specific item combinations onto an outfit that can be stored in the glamour dresser. Outfits stored in this manner only take up a single glamour slot.
As with standard glamours, outfit glamours can be projected onto your gear or added to glamour plates.
To create an outfit glamour, you must possess the corresponding combination of items of identical quality, and an equivalent number of glamour prisms.
When opening the glamour dresser, outfit glamour-ready items are identified by the button displayed in the Glamour Creation window.

Selecting this button will open the Outfit Glamour Creation window. Here you can select items from your Inventory and Armoury Chest to include in the outfit glamour. Gear with condition below 100% cannot be used to form an outfit glamour.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Unlike standard glamours, the color of dyed gear is not transferred to an outfit glamour.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
※Outfit glamours can still be dyed after being projected onto gear or added to a glamour plate.
When creating an outfit glamour, several items are combined as an ensemble and saved to the glamour dresser.
You can check which items can be combined to form an outfit glamour by selecting the “View Outfit Glamour-ready Items” subcommand of an outfit glamour-ready item.
Item combinations saved as outfit glamours can be viewed under the Outfits tab of the glamour dresser.

In addition to viewing currently saved outfits under this tab, you can also inspect the individual items that form an outfit by selecting the “Inspect Outfit” subcommand. This subcommand is also accessible via each individual item.
As with standard glamours, individual items that form part of an outfit glamour are displayed under their corresponding tab in the glamour dresser. These items are identified as such in the corresponding item details window.
Restoring an outfit glamour will return each included item to its original form.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Specific items from an outfit glamour cannot be restored individually.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Cast Bars
Some enemy attacks take time to cast before they strike. A progress bar will appear beside the name of the caster, and once this bar fills completely, the attack will be unleashed.
Note that attacks with no cast time will not display a cast bar.

On the Occult Crescent, players must explore widely and overcome deadly threats, all in aid of unraveling the isle's mysteries.

■Basic Rules Players can enter the Occult Crescent solo or in a party. It is possible to form a party even after entering the instance.
■Requirements A <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Disciple of War or Magic level 100 or higher<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is required to enter, and the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>required average item level is 690<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
■Restrictions Once inside, you are free to change to any Disciple of War or Magic that meets the requirements to enter. However, you cannot change jobs in certain circumstances, including while participating in a critical encounter.
All expeditions on the Occult Crescent are level synced, with <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>character levels adjusted to 100, and all equipment adjusted to item level 700<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

Progress during the expedition is represented by your <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>knowledge level<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, with all players starting at level 1.
Discrepancies between your knowledge level and that of your enemies can greatly impact the outcome of a battle. Caution is advised when engaging a foe with a knowledge level greater than your own.

Players can accumulate <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>knowledge<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>─akin to experience points─by defeating enemies and completing quests on the Occult Crescent.
Slaying foes with a knowledge level higher than your own will garner more knowledge. Players may choose to form parties and take on such adversaries to reap the increased knowledge reward.
Knowledge can also be earned by participating in critical encounters and FATEs across the island.
Your knowledge level and accrued knowledge will be retained between excursions─progress will not be lost when you depart the Occult Crescent.

Falling in battle while out on an excursion will incur a penalty. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>If you are incapacitated and return to base camp without being revived, you will lose a portion of your knowledge.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The amount of knowledge lost is dependent on your knowledge level. Players who leave the instance while incapacitated will also receive the aforementioned penalty.
Furthermore, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>if your knowledge level is above 5, incurring the penalty can decrease your knowledge level<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> if your knowledge falls below zero as a result.

While exploring the Occult Crescent, players can utilize additional, supplemental jobs known as <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>phantom jobs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Selecting a phantom job bestows a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>beneficial status and grants access to an array of phantom actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Although only one phantom job may be selected, under most circumstances you are free to make a different selection at any time. Leveraging various phantom jobs as the need arises may be the difference between victory and defeat out in the field.

Utilizing a phantom job to defeat your adversaries will garner <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>phantom EXP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Earning sufficient phantom EXP will increase the level of your selected phantom job, granting access to a variety of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>offensive, restorative, and supplemental phantom actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

Upon acquisition, phantom actions are registered to the phantom action panel, which displays within Occult Crescent zones <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>in place of the duty action HUD.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Phantom actions can be executed and toggled using the following methods:
<var 08 E4E95101 ((■Keyboard and Mouse By clicking phantom action icons displayed on the HUD.
■<var 08 E1E94C01 ((Controller)) ((Gamepad)) /var> By pressing <var 12 12 /var> with the cross hotbar active. <var 1E 0F /var>＋<var 12 12 /var>: Select Phantom Action <var 1E 10 /var>＋<var 12 12 /var>: Execute Phantom Action )) ((■<var 08 E1E94C01 ((Controller)) ((Gamepad)) /var> By pressing <var 12 12 /var> with the cross hotbar active. <var 1E 0F /var>＋<var 12 12 /var>: Select Phantom Action <var 1E 10 /var>＋<var 12 12 /var>: Execute Phantom Action
■Keyboard and Mouse By clicking phantom action icons displayed on the HUD. )) /var> ■Registering Duty Actions to the Hotbar / Cross Hotbar If you register Duty Actions I and II found under the Duties tab in Actions & Traits to your hotbar or cross hotbar, these icons will automatically switch to Execute Phantom Action and Toggle Phantom Action, respectively, while on the Occult Crescent.
■Registering Phantom Actions to the Hotbar / Cross Hotbar If you register Phantom Actions I-V found under the Duties tab in Actions & Traits to your hotbar or cross hotbar, these icons will automatically switch to their respective phantom actions while on the Occult Crescent.

Leveling your phantom jobs can provide access to job-specific <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>phantom traits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> which in turn boost the effectiveness of your phantom actions or grant special techniques.

The roster of phantom jobs available to you is expanded by learning ancient martial and arcane techniques contained within <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>soul shards.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Soul shards are obtained from treasure chests, certain critical encounters, and more. Explore the Occult Crescent to find them!

The first phantom job available to you is that of the freelancer, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>a basic job suited to exploration.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Freelancers do not gain experience through traditional means. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Instead, it levels up with every additional phantom job you master.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
On the Occult Crescent, a party is considered balanced <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>so long as all members are within three knowledge levels of one another.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Enemies defeated by a balanced party will award <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>10% more phantom experience.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Additionally, because your knowledge level is adjusted to the average level of all party members, everyone is able to take part in combat on even footing─an appealing advantage compared to exploring alone!

If your party is not balanced, each member will enter combat at their current knowledge level, resulting in a strength discrepancy.
To avoid this, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>the party leader may choose to toggle knowledge level sync on or off.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
When enabled, this setting adjusts the knowledge level of all members three or more levels higher than the member whose knowledge level is lowest, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>automatically creating a balanced party.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Under certain conditions, defeating enemies on the Occult Crescent will result in <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>EXP chains.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Generally, it occurs upon defeating <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>an enemy whose knowledge level exceeds your own,<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> but the exact threshold will change depending on party size.
Solo: 2 levels higher 2 players: 3 levels higher 3 or 4 players: 4 or 5 levels higher 5 or 6 players: 6 or 7 levels higher 7 or 8 players: 7 or 8 levels higher

The more high-level enemies defeated within a set time period, the larger the chain will grow; <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>the bigger the level difference, the faster the growth rate.<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var> Form a party with your comrades and reap greater rewards!

Critical encounters are large-scale battles wherein up to 72 players band together to take on powerful opponents. Prove yourself victorious and you'll gain considerable knowledge, among other rewards.
Unlike enemies in the wild, foes fought in critical encounters are <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>unaffected by knowledge level,<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> so all players who join the fray will do so on even ground.
Even better, a uniquely powerful enhancing effect will be applied to those who win the battle under set conditions!

To take part in a critical encounter, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>you need only reach its location on the map.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> This may necessitate travel through areas infested with dangerous enemies, so have care.

The Forked Towers are the greatest challenge to be found on the Occult Crescent.
Make full use of your phantom jobs and work together with up to 48 total players to overcome powerful foes and tricky battle mechanics!

Only those with a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>knowledge level of 20 or greater<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> may enter the Forked Tower: Blood.
To do so, an aetherial node must be powered through the coordinated use of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>sanguine ciphers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> purchased from the expedition antiquarian at the base camp.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>A minimum of 16 players must offer sanguine ciphers within a set timeframe.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Those selected to enter will receive the Right of Entry: The Forked Tower status effect, granting them clearance to enter the Forked Tower: Blood.
A short time after the node is activated, a maximum of 48 players standing upon it will be teleported inside. Should more than 48 players board the node, players who invested a greater number of ciphers will have a higher chance of being selected for entry.
On the Occult Crescent, there are two forms of currency: Enlightenment silver pieces and Enlightenment gold pieces.

■Enlightenment Silver Pieces Primarily acquired from critical encounters and FATEs.
■Enlightenment Gold Pieces Primarily acquired from defeating enemies in the wild.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Both can be traded to the expedition antiquarian at the base camp for a variety of items.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Knowledge crystals are ancient artifacts erected around the Occult Crescent.

These crystals <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>resonate with certain phantom actions and apply a variety of effects to you and your party members.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Use them to your advantage!
The Occult Crescent is teeming with treasure for the taking.
These chests are only visible to you, so if you catch sight of one while exploring, don't hesitate to open it!

Certain shops sell equipment imbued with special enhancements that only take effect when worn within Occult Crescent areas.
Notably, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>enhancements to special attribute will increase damage dealt by phantom actions.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
You may also trade items to the expedition armorer at the base camp in exchange for gear upgrades.
Weaponry Displacement System

As the battle progresses, the weaponry displacement system will come into effect. While activated, three types of neutral weaponry may be deployed around the Heliodrome:
1. Interceptor Drones 2. Interceptor Command Systems 3. Interceptor Nodes
Interceptor Drones

Interceptor drones are small enemies that engage surrounding players with automatic cannons before self-detonating after an allotted time has passed. Defeating them will distribute tactical points proportional to damage contribution and raise the rating of the party that contributed the most.
When interceptor drones are deployed, a golden interceptor drone α may appear. Defeating these rare enemies will result in greater rewards than regular interceptor drones. Both types of enemies will keep respawning as long as the weaponry displacement system is in effect.
Interceptor Command Systems

Interceptor command systems are medium-sized enemies that cannot be targeted and attack continuously after deployment. By swiftly absorbing attacks according to its indicators, players can reduce damage taken, earn tactical points, and increase rating.
Interceptor Nodes

Interceptor nodes are large enemies that indiscriminately target surrounding players with a variety of attacks. ・Ground Interference: A large area-of-effect attack. ・Heavy Interference: A stack marker attack. ・Targeted Interference: A honing attack.
Every time this enemy's HP is reduced to zero, it will gain one point. When it has accrued five points, it will begin to flash, indicating that it may be defeated. Teams will accrue tactical points according to damage contribution each time the interceptor node's HP is reduced to zero.
Personnel Displacement Panels

Personnel displacement panels are one-way teleporters installed throughout the field for personal use. They may be active or inactive depending on the state of battle. ・Active: Thirty seconds before the weaponry displacement system activates. ・Inactive: When the weaponry displacement system deactivates and at the start of battle.
