Cosmic Exploration is <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>an initiative wherein Disciples of the Hand and Land join forces to achieve interstellar travel.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

■The Basics For this project to achieve liftoff, Searchingway has need of your artisanal skills. Objectives can be completed solo or in groups.
As the initiative progresses, your surrounds will be expanded with new facilities and areas to explore. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Work together with the denizens of your Home World and watch your efforts pay off in real time!<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

To ensure the success of the Cosmic Exploration Initiative, contributors are asked to undertake a variety of different activities.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Stellar Missions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Stellar missions enlist Disciples of the Hand and Land to leverage their specialist skills and provide materials and crafted items to help further the initiative.
You can confirm rewards and requirements of currently available missions via the Stellar Missions section of the exotablet.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Mech Ops & Red Alerts<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Mech op directives and red alerts are issued without warning to contributors in the field.
The former sees participants pilot mechanized walkers known as vacuum suits to undertake a variety of missions. Due to the technical nature of this work, these missions offer special rewards unobtainable through other activities.
Stellar missions are <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>requests issued to Disciples of the Hand and Land for the purpose of furthering the initiative.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
■Accepting Missions Select Stellar Missions from the exotablet to view a list of available missions.
Select a mission from the list to view its location, rewards, and other details.
When you're ready to begin, select the Initiate button to undertake the mission. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>You may only accept one at a time.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
■Duty List Appears whenever a stellar mission is active. Heed the instructions to fulfill the request!
■Mission in Progress During an active mission, select Stellar Missions on the exotablet to open the Mission in Progress window. Here, you may review all the relevant details of your mission.

■Mission Complete Once you have achieved your objective, you may select the Report button from the Mission in Progress window to complete the mission and receive your rewards. ※For a higher payout, achieve a silver or gold star rating before reporting.
The Mission in Progress window displays details and commands relevant to your ongoing stellar mission.

■Cosmic Crafting Log Exclusive to cosmic exploration, this crafting log contains recipes specific to Disciple of the Hand stellar missions.
Choose a recipe, then select the Synthesize button to begin cosmic crafting in much the same fashion as ordinary crafting.

■Stellar Reduction A type of aetherial reduction performed upon materials acquired through Disciple of the Land stellar missions.
■Abandon Select the Abandon button to forfeit an incomplete mission.
■Ratings Upon completing a mission, you will be awarded a bronze, silver, or gold star rating according to the level of your success. This, in turn, affects the mission's reward payout as follows:
Bronze: No Bonus Silver: 4x Bonus Gold: 5x Bonus
Any mission completed with a bronze or silver star rating will henceforth have a checkmark beside its name in the mission selection list, whereas missions completed with a gold star rating will have a special symbol instead.
The cosmopouch is <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>a separate inventory reserved exclusively for cosmic exploration.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Mech ops are <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>special missions that occur at random intervals, utilizing powerful vacuum suits to help carry them out to completion.<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>
■Mech Op Directives When mech op directives are issued, an announcement will be made to all players in the exploration zone.
■Participation Players may take part as either pilots or ground support, each role having different requirements for participation.

Pilots are charged with <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>operating powerful mechs called vacuum suits in order to carry out these missions.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Each time a mech op order is issued, pilots will be selected at random from those who apply.

■Pilot Applications To be selected as a pilot, players will be asked to submit a pilot application. These can be obtained from Alerot in Sinus Ardorum (X:22.4 Y:20.3) in exchange for lunar credits.
■Submitting Applications Once a mech op has been issued, those seeking to serve as pilots may do so by accessing the Mech Ops Registration menu via their exotablets.
Those who possess an application will then be allowed to submit.

After the application period has concluded, those selected to be pilots will receive a notification.
A final verification prompt will then be displayed, after which pilots will board their vehicles and be transported to the mission site.
Please be advised that <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>any active stellar missions will be canceled.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
■Processed Applications Applications are only processed and taken from players who are selected to be pilots. Please note that, once taken, they will not be returned should you later decide to forfeit your position as pilot.

Ground supporters are <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>another important role in the completion of mech ops, whereby players participate without the use of vacuum suits.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

■Participation To join mech ops as a ground supporter, players must proceed directly to the mission site and select “Join Event.”
■Reaching the Mission Site When a mech ops directive has been issued, players may speak with Alerot in Sinus Ardorum (X:22.4 Y:20.3) to be transported immediately to the mission site.
■Ground Supporter's Duty Resources gathered during mech ops must be fed into nearby field scanners. When sufficient resources have been gathered, the field scanners will activate, revealing targets for mech pilots to strike.
■Special Rewards As thanks for completion of missions as ground support, players who make sufficient contributions will receive a buff that increases the number of credits received when completing stellar missions.
Further details can be found under “Stellar Mission Rules.”

By assisting in the Cosmic Exploration Initiative, player contributions are recorded and tallied over regular intervals. These accumulated scores are used to rank players in the Starward Standings.
Players with the highest score at the end of any given ranking period are designated <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Star Contributor<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Ranking periods will last twenty-four hours (Earth time), from <var 06 13 /var><var 08 DB ((<var 09 DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C /var>)) 0D /var> <var 08 E0DB0D ((p.m.)) ((a.m.)) /var> (Earth time) to <var 06 13 /var><var 08 DB ((<var 09 DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C /var>)) 0D /var> <var 08 E0DB0D ((p.m.)) ((a.m.)) /var> (Earth time) the following day. Once the Star Contributors have been selected, a twenty-four hour interim will follow before the next ranking period begins. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>※In the event of server maintenance during a ranking period, players with the highest score in the available time before or after maintenance will be designated Star Contributor.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Player scores can be increased by undertaking stellar missions, or participating in mech ops and cosmic exploration projects.
After completion of the aforementioned activities, a system message will display in the log window noting the size of your contribution.
To learn more about these tallying periods or your present score, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>speak with Scanningway at the Moongate Hub.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Players selected as Star Contributor will receive special accolades that last for fourteen days (Earth time) from the time they are chosen.
While Star Contributors cannot be selected again during this fourteen day period, should they have the highest score on the fourteenth day, they can maintain their status as Star Contributor without interruption.
Players selected as Star Contributor will glow with a special aura while in cosmic exploration zones.

This aura will only appear when playing as a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Disciple of the Hand or Land<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Players may disable the aura by manually turning off the status effect “Astral Aura.” However, it will reset after leaving and re-entering the cosmic exploration zone.
Current Star Contributors can be confirmed at any time via the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Starward Standings stela<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

The Starward Standings stela also displays a number of previously selected Star Contributors.
You can select any of their names to view a congratulatory message from the Cosmic Exploration Initiative.
Players selected as Star Contributor will also be commemorated with a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>hologram of their visage in the cosmic exploration zone<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
If you have been selected, you may change the pose of your hologram at any time by accessing the Starward Standings stela.

The Infrastructure Index allows you to <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>monitor the overall progress of the Cosmic Exploration Initiative as well as review entries in the development log.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
You can view the index at any time via the Infrastructure Index section of the exotablet.

■Confirming Progress Information about the current infrastructure project and overall cosmic exploration progress is displayed at the top of the window. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>※See the “Projects” section of this guide for further details about infrastructure projects.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
■Development Log Reports on current and past development phases are listed on the left side of the window. Footage of each phase can be viewed via the Video Log button.

Projects are collaborative endeavors in which <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Disciples of the Hand and Land work together to complete tasks<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, contributing towards the construction and expansion of various facilities.

Once the Cosmic Exploration Initiative has progressed to a certain point, and the necessary groundwork is complete, project <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>commencement timing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is determined. Details about preparation progress and project commencement timing can be found in the Infrastructure Index section of the exotablet.
The location of any projects currently underway is displayed on the map.

Depending on the project site and objective, participants will be required to perform various tasks, such as <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>transporting materials, fabricating parts, and removing obstacles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
When the progress bar is filled, the project will draw to a close, and cosmocredits and experience points will be awarded based on <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>contribution<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Successfully completing projects will transform the environment and further the exploration effort.

Stellar successes are milestones based on your contributions to the initiative. Various rewards are bestowed upon reaching these milestones.
You can keep track of your progress via the Stellar Successes section of the exotablet.

Stellar successes are divided into two categories: daily successes, which track your day-to-day achievements, and standard successes, which track your overall contribution to the initiative.
Participating in stellar missions and mech ops are just two of the many ways you can attain stellar successes and reap the rewards.
Beware that rewards received above and beyond your carrying capacity will be disposed of.

Daily successes reward <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>short-term contributions to the initiative on a day-to-day basis<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. These milestones can be viewed under the Daily tab in the Stellar Successes section of the exotablet.

Completing daily successes awards Daily Success Points. Different rewards are available depending on the number of points accrued.
Daily success progress is reset each day at <var 06 13 /var><var 08 DB ((<var 09 DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C /var>)) 0D /var> <var 08 E0DB0D ((p.m.)) ((a.m.)) /var> (Earth time).

Standard successes reward <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>long-term contributions over the course of the initiative<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. These milestones can be viewed under the Standard tab in the Stellar Successes section of the exotablet.
Corresponding rewards are given upon reaching each milestone.
The Cosmoliner is a convenient, high-speed transport network linking points of strategic importance across the exploration zone. Simply approach the warp gate to be whisked off to your destination.
As you work with other contributors to further the initiative, new sections of the Cosmoliner network will be added, providing swift access to more distant locales.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Data gathered during the course of the initiative supports cosmic research<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>─an endeavor dedicated to the pursuit of interstellar exploration.
As part of this research, analytical tasks are set for each Disciple of the Hand and Land class. Completing missions will procure the data necessary to complete these tasks and advance to the next research stage.
Details can be viewed in the Cosmic Research section of the exotablet.
When opened, the Cosmic Research Information window displays current research objectives for each class.

Once you have gathered enough data to complete your current analytical task, you can submit your report to Researchingway. The data-driven Loporrit will reward your hard work by upgrading your cosmic tool.
An icon will appear on the exotablet when you have sufficient data to report.

Designed for Disciples of the Hand and Land, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>cosmic tools are the technological culmination of Researchingway's fastidious data analysis<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
As you complete analytical tasks, the ingenious Loporrit can upgrade your cosmic tool to ever-increasing heights of utility.

Cosmic fortunes are <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>one of several reward systems players will encounter while participating in cosmic exploration.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Using credits earned through contributions to the initiative, you can draw fortunes to receive various prizes.

Contributions to the Cosmic Exploration Initiative are rewarded with credits based on the planet where they are made. In the case of Sinus Ardorum, players will receive lunar credits.
These credits may then be spent to <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>draw cosmic fortunes by speaking with Orbitingway, each draw costing 1,000 credits.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Mission Types
After paying the requisite credits, the cosmic fortune drawing will begin, and players will be presented with two roulette wheels.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Each roulette contains a unique set of prizes.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> After selecting one, the roulette wheel will be spun, and players will receive rewards based on where it stops.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>The roulette wheel has a chance to stop on a special marker, granting players a Stellar Opportunity.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Stopping on Stellar Opportunity will reveal a new roulette wheel with a new set of special prizes.

Players who make substantial contributions to mech ops may be rewarded with a ticket for a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Big Bang fortune<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Should you receive one of these tickets, speak with Orbitingway to test your luck on a special roulette wheel for a chance to win extravagant prizes.
Operating in volatile environs is not without its challenges. At times, unforeseen developments may call for emergency measures.

Whenever these hazards result in major obstacles to the initiative, the Moongate Hub will issue a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>red alert<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Heed the call to arms, and work together with your comrades to resolve the crisis!
During an active red alert, you may aid in its resolution by undertaking <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>critical missions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Depending on the type of emergency, some critical missions may only be available to certain classes. Whenever your specific expertise is in demand, you will be compensated handsomely for offering it.
During an active red alert, everyone must work together to resolve the most pressing issues at hand. Progress on that front is indicated by the alert gauge.

Each progress bar represents a different ongoing problem. Your objective is to ensure that <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>both are filled within the allotted time<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. If successful, all contributors shall receive bonus rewards at the conclusion of the red alert.
While a critical mission is active, the classes in demand are listed to the left of each progress bar. Change classes as necessary to lend a hand wherever you're needed most!

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>So long as the timer has yet to expire, you are free to undertake critical missions, even if the progress bars are already full.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Your reward will not be impacted.
For the Cosmic Exploration Initiative, there's no such thing as too many supplies, so don't hesitate to contribute if you have the time!

Critical missions may only be undertaken while a red alert is active. Upon its conclusion, you will be unable to complete the mission.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Additionally, once the timer falls below one minute, you will be unable to accept a new mission, as you will not have sufficient time to complete it.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Cosmocredits are a type of currency earned through contributions to the Cosmic Exploration Initiative. At the Credit Exchange, they can be used to purchase a variety of supplies and even exclusive wares!
■How to Earn Cosmocredits Cosmocredits are primarily earned through the completion of stellar missions, but are also awarded through stellar successes and other avenues. Some tasks, such as construction projects, are more lucrative than others!

Though objectives, rating milestones, and other details may vary, each mission generally falls under one of the following categories:
■Stock Up on Items Utilize your crafting or gathering abilities to collect a specific item. Upon reaching the requisite quantity, the mission is complete.
Disciples of the Hand may earn greater compensation by submitting high-quality items, whereas Disciples of the Land will be richly rewarded for items with a higher collectability rating. You can review the requisite milestones on the item help window.
■Race against Time For these missions, the objective must be completed within the time limit, whether it's gathering a set quantity of items or fishing up different types of marine life. The faster you finish, the better your rating.
■Chains and Gatherer's Boon (Miners and Botanists Only) Achieve as many successful chains and instances of Gatherer's Boon as possible. Upon achieving the requisite score, the mission is complete.
■Big Fish (Fishers Only) For these missions, your rating is determined by the size of your fish. Some missions will evaluate your single biggest catch, while others measure the average size of your entire haul. Upon meeting the requisite size, the mission is complete.

Lunar credits are a type of currency earned through contributions to the exploration of Sinus Ardorum. They can be used to purchase cosmic fortunes as well as pilot applications for use in mech ops.
■How to Earn Lunar Credits Lunar credits are primarily earned through the completion of stellar missions, but are also awarded through stellar successes and other avenues. During red alerts, complete critical missions for an even bigger payout!
Each submitted report will increase the quantity and variety of data collectable via missions─a key concern for the budding cosmic researcher.
Stellar Mission Rules
Cosmic Class Score
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Any materials or bait required for stellar missions will be placed in your cosmopouch free of charge upon commencement.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
The cosmopouch also holds your gathered resources, fish, and cosmic crafts. Upon completing a stellar mission, the relevant items are automatically submitted to the initiative.
The Exotablet
Zone Effects and Rules

When a red alert is issued, players are called upon to participate in critical missions, which must be completed within the specified time. For those who join forces and resolve these crises, generous rewards await.

Further details regarding both mission types can be found under the Mech Ops and Red Alert headings of this guide.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>■Completing Projects and Initiative Progress<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Once players on a particular World have progressed to a certain point, they can begin to undertake projects.
Completing these endeavors will greatly further the initiative and bring about a number of changes in the field. Given their importance to the initiative's enduring success, these projects offer lucrative rewards to those who lend their expertise.
Please refer to the Projects heading for more information.

The exotablet is <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>a HUD feature exclusive to cosmic exploration zones<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from which you may review important information pertaining to every aspect of the initiative.

■Main Window From this window, you have access to each facet of exploration, enabling you to accept stellar missions and check the overall progress of the initiative.
■Cosmocredits Cosmocredits are a type of formless currency issued by the initiative and accepted at any interstellar base camp. The amount in your possession is displayed on your exotablet.
■Lunar Credits Lunar credits are another type of formless currency issued by the initiative, but accepted only at the Moongate Hub. As with cosmocredits, the amount in your possession is displayed on your exotablet.

Players participating in the Cosmic Exploration Initiative are subject to a number of rules and effects.
■Traveling to Sinus Ardorum Players may speak with Drivingway in Bestways Burrow (X:21.9 Y:13.2) to gain passage to Sinus Ardorum. Upon arrival you can travel between instances by speaking to Drivingway again in Sinus Ardorum (X:20.3 Y:20.0).
■Stellar Return Stellar Return can be used anywhere within cosmic exploration zones. Upon use, players are transported to the rainbow crystal located in the center of the zone.
■Stellar Sprint Within cosmic exploration zones, the rainbow crystal converts a crafter or gatherer's Sprint action into Stellar Sprint, boosting movement speed and effect duration.
■Mount Usage Excluding the mechs ridden by select pilot candidates during a mech ops directive, mounts are not permitted within the exploration zone.

In the beginning, you are only permitted to undertake class D stellar missions. You will gradually unlock more difficult tasks upon reaching the requisite conditions, which can be found below the mission selection list.

There are a few special rules and restrictions associated with stellar missions:
■Quest Sync The difficulty of crafting and gathering missions, as well as the amount of experience earned, will be adjusted to your current level at the time of commencement.
■Crafting and Gathering Restrictions During a stellar mission, crafting and gathering will not award experience, and spiritbond will accrue at a different rate.
■Fishing Restrictions At the end of each stellar mission, your Angler's Art stacks will be reset, regardless of how many you have accrued.
■Ground Support Bonuses Ground supporters who make sufficient contributions to a mech op will receive bonus credits for a certain number of subsequent missions, regardless of objective. These bonuses are as follows:
Cosmocredits: +10 Lunar Credits: +10
For the duration of the effect, an arrow symbol will be displayed on the Initiate button on the mission selection window.

The cosmic class score refers to <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>the points individual players accrue by taking part in cosmic exploration, separated by class.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Whenever you complete a stellar mission, you will earn points for your chosen class. Reaching certain milestones will grant achievements and, in some cases, titles.
You may view your current score by selecting the Cosmic Class Tracker from your exotablet.
Changing Phantom Jobs
Items and Phantom Actions
Happy Bunnies
Persistent Pots
Select the character icon on the Occult Crescent HUD to open the phantom job window and view a list of actions and traits associated with your current phantom job.
On the phantom job window, select the character icon again to view your phantom job repertoire. From here, you may change jobs by selecting a different character icon.

Some phantom actions, such as the Phantom Chemist's Occult Potion and the Phantom Samurai's Zeninage, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>consume specific items upon use.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
These items are available for purchase with gil or Enlightenment pieces from the expedition supplier and antiquarian.

Treasure chests on the Occult Crescent sometimes hold a fortune carrot. With one in your possession, you may start to notice signs of happy bunnies nearby.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Using the fortune carrot on the spot<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will draw the little leporine elementals out into the open.
Happy bunnies are known to repay kind adventurers with treasure, so be sure to offer them any fortune carrots you find!
Some FATEs on the Occult Crescent will task you with defending magic pots from hostile creatures.

Of those who contribute sufficiently to the successful completion of these FATEs, 20 players will be selected at random to receive an elixir, the scent of which will entice a persistent pot to give chase.
These soulkin can sense buried treasure and will offer hints as to its location <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>in exchange for sips of elixir.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Use these clues to seek out hidden riches!
Mastering Phantom Jobs

Upon reaching a phantom job's maximum level, you will receive the Phantom Mastery status, which grants increased damage dealt and other helpful effects, and remains active even should you change to another phantom job.
The more jobs you master, the more powerful your Phantom Mastery effects become, so intrepid adventurers will want to deepen their knowledge of many a lost art.
